\begin{document}           % End of preamble and beginning of text.

\maketitle

\abstract{
We consider CIV-DV
prepotential $\mathcal{F}$ for $\mathcal{N}=1$ $SU(n)$ SYM theory at the
extremum  of the effective
 superpotential and prove the relation
 $$2\mathcal{F}-S^i {\partial \mathcal{F} \over \partial S_i}=-u_2{2\Lambda^{2n}\over(n^2-1)}$$}


\setcounter{equation}{0}
\section{Introduction}

In this note we consider the Cachazo-Intriligator-Vafa prepotential \cite{CIV,DV} for $\mathcal{N}=1$ $SU(n)$ SYM
theory, which is equal \cite{DV} to the free energy $F_m$ for the one matrix holomorphic
integral with the polynomial potential, defined as a perturbative
expansion around the certain extremum of the action.
